intro: Leucanthemopsis pulverulenta, commonly known as the dustflower, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a powdery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
